qas.question: Which president initially began to desegregate the US military?
When did the desegregation of the United States Armed Forces begin?
When did Eisenhower deliver his first State of the Union?
What control did Eisenhower use to push through desegregation?
In what geographical area did Eisenhower promise to end desegregation in his State of the Union address?

context: While President <a0_0>Truman<a0_0/> had begun the process of desegregating the Armed Forces in <a1_0>1948<a1_0/>, actual implementation had been slow. Eisenhower made clear his stance in his first State of the Union address in <a2_0>February 1953<a2_0/>, saying "I propose to use whatever authority exists in the office of the President to end segregation in the <a4_0>District of Columbia<a4_0/>, including the Federal Government, and any segregation in the Armed Forces". When he encountered opposition from the services, he used government control of <a3_0>military spending<a3_0/> to force the change through, stating "Wherever Federal Funds are expended ..., I do not see how any American can justify ... a discrimination in the expenditure of those funds".
